intro: Podosperma gnaphaloides, commonly known as the alpine hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are usually basal, with a woolly texture, and its yellow flowers bloom in the summer months. Podosperma gnaphaloides is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in high-altitude ecosystems.
